Award.AwardTitle: Conference on Complex Geometry and Several Complex Variables
Award.AbstractNarration:
This award provides funding for US participation in the conference "Conference on Complex Geometry and Several Complex Variables" that will be held March 9-11, 2018 at the University of Notre Dame.


The conference focuses on recent developments in Analysis, especially in the field of complex geometry. A number of distinguished mathematicians have agreed to attend and speak at this conference. This award gives early career researchers, members of underrepresented groups, researchers not funded by NSF and the like an opportunity to attend and participate in this conference. The organizing committee will strive to make this funding opportunity known to target groups through a number of different activities. More information will be made available at:

https://www3.nd.edu/~conf/complex_geometry2018/

POR.DRECONTENT:
The NSF grant was used to support the conference on Complex Geometry and Several Complex Variables.  The conference was held at the University of Notre Dame, March 9-11, 2018.  There were 70 registered conference participants. The purpose of this conference is to gather experts in the field of complex geometry, especially CR geometry  and several complex variables, to report and understand the recent exciting discoveries and techniques.
 
There were eight one-hour talks and eight half-hour shorter talks  during the conference.The organizing committee conscientiously invited a number of junior researchers and graduate students to the conference. Some of them were given the opportunity to present their results at the conference. The majority of the NSF  funds were used to support graduate students and early career mathematicians, with priority given to women and other underrepresented groups. Many of the junior participants  were invited after the conference to continue the research.  Five of the invited speakers at the conference are women, four of them are junior women.

The conference and the follow-up  activities  had facilitated collaboration across diverse areas of the related subjects. Many new ideas and the rapid developments in this area were exchanged and  passed on to a new generation of mathematicians.

More information on the conference can be found at the conference website
 
 https://www3.nd.edu/~conf/complex geometry2018/
